page.title: 08FARMING - Arable fruit farm
page.content:
It is 300 acres.They grow barley in the winter to make beer and whisky. They have grass to let to other farmers.They grow hay for winter bedding.They grow fruit called strawberries,gooseberries,blackcurrants and raspberries.They are sprayed every two weeks.They have to get a field ready for a car park so people can pick their own fruit.In Autumn all the old plants are cut down.They grow early,mid and late potatoes.They have an automatic planter with an electronic eye and it is four times faster.One man can plant five acres in a day.
PRICES (July,1985) Strawberries 36p/pound Gooseberries 20p/pound Raspberries 40p/pound Red Currants 34p/pound (Tom Daniel Age 6)
